member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter
member.summary: Represents a user control used to display altitude.
member.remarks: Altimeters are used to visually represent some form of altitude, typically the user's current altitude above sea level. Altitude is measured using three needles which represent (from longest to shortest) hundreds, thousands and tens-of-thousands. The display of the Altimeter is controlled via the Value property.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarControl
member.summary: Represents a base class for round controls painted using polar coordinates.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl
member.summary: Represents a base class for designing flicker-free, multithreaded user controls.

remarks.para: This powerful and versatile class provides a framework upon which to create high-performance owner-drawn controls. Common rendering challenges such as multithreading, thread synchronization, double-buffering, performance tuning, platform tuning and animation are all handled by this class.

Controls which inherit from this class perform all paint operations by overriding the OnPaintOffScreen method, and optionally the OnPaintOffScreenBackground and OnPaintOffScreenAdornments methods. Controls which demand higher performance should perform all rendering on a separate thread. This is done by setting the IsPaintingOnSeparateThread property to True. Since the actual painting of the control is handled by this class, the OnPaint method should not be overridden.

When all off-screen paint operations have completed, this class will copy the contents of the off-screen bitmap to the on-screen bitmap which is visibly displayed on the control. By deferring all rendering operations to another thread, the user interface remains very responsive even during time-consuming paint operations.

Performance tuning is another major feature of this class. The OptimizationMode property gives developers the ability to tune rendering performance for animation speed, rendering quality, low CPU usage, or a balance between all three.

While thread synchronization has been implemented wherever possible in this class, and the class is almost entirely thread-safe, some care should be taken when accessing base Control properties from a separate thread. Even basic properties like Visible can fail, especially on the Compact Framework. For minimal threading issues, avoid reading control properties during paint events.

This class has been tuned to deliver the best performance on all versions of the .NET Framework (1.0, 1.1 and 2.0) as well as the .NET Compact Framework (1.0 and 2.0). Compatibility is also managed internally, which simplifies the process of porting controls to the Compact Framework.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified thread name.
member.param: The name associated with the rendering thread when rendering is multithreaded. This name appears in the Output window when the thread exits and can be useful during debugging. The name should also contain a company or support URL.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.ResumePainting
member.summary: Allows the control to be repainted after a call to SuspendPainting.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.SuspendPainting
member.summary: Temporarily pauses all painting operations.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.InvokeRepaint
member.summary: Repaints the control either directly or via the painting thread.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Repaint
member.summary: Redraws the control off-screen.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnPaintException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Occurs when an exception occurs during a multithreaded paint operation.

remarks.para: Exceptions caught during rendering iterations are channeled through this method instead of being re-thrown. This allows developers the ability to silently handle rendering problems without letting them interrupt the user interface. This method invokes the ExceptionOccurred event.

member.param: An Exception object describing the rendering error.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnTargetFrameRateChanged(System.Int32)
member.summary: Occurs when the desired frame rate has changed.
member.remarks: This virtual method is called whenever the TargetFrameRate property has changed. This method gives controls the opportunity to adjust animation effects to achieve the frame rate as closely as possible.
member.param: An Integer specifying the ideal or desired frame rate for the control.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnPaintOffScreen(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Performs all major painting operations for the control.

remarks.para: This method must be overridden. All painting operations for the control take place during this method. After this method completes, the OnPaintOffScreenAdornments method is called. When all painting operations have completed, the task of repainting the control visually takes place automatically.

Developers seeking to upgrade their existing controls to use this control must move all code from OnPaint into OnPaintOffScreen. For best performance, the OnPaint method would not be overridden at all.

member.param: A CancelablePaintEventArgs object used for all painting operations, as well as to signal when a rendering iteration has been aborted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnPaintOffScreenBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Optional. Performs painting operations which draw the control's background.

remarks.para: This method provides the ability to prepare the background of the control before major painting operations take place. By default, this method calls the Graphics.Clear method to erase the control to the background color.

This method can be overridden to perform certain visual effects. For example, the PolarControl class, which inherits from this class, uses this method to apply a fading circular gradient to create a 3D illusion. Then, the OnPaintOffScreenAdornments method is also overridden to apply a second effect which gives the appearance of glass over the control. For more information on glass effects, see the Effect property of the PolarControl class.

member.param: A CancelablePaintEventArgs object used for all painting operations, as well as to signal when a rendering iteration has been aborted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnPaintOffScreenAdornments(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Optional. Performs any additional painting operations after the main portions of the control are painted.
member.remarks: By default, this method does nothing. This method can be overridden to apply certain details, however, such as a watermark, company logo, or glass. For example, the PolarControl class overrides this method to apply a glass effect on top of anything that has already been painted. For more information on glass effects, see the Effect property of the PolarControl class.
member.param: A CancelablePaintEventArgs object used for all painting operations, as well as to signal when a rendering iteration has been aborted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnInitialize
member.summary: Occurs when the control is about to be rendered for the first time.

remarks.para: This virtual method provides the ability to prepare any local variables before the control is painted for the first time. This method is typically used to create GDI objects such as Pen, Brush, and Font immediately before they are needed. It is recommended that this event be used to create any such GDI objects. Additionally, it is also recommended that GDI objects get created outside of the OnPaintOffScreen method if they are used repeatedly.

For desktop framework applications, this method is called when the control's handle is created. For Compact Framework 1.0 applications, there is no handle creation event, so this method is called when the first call to OnPaint occurs.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: Occurs when the control is to be redrawn on-screen.

remarks.para: In the DoubleBufferedControl class, the process of painting the control on-screen is handled automatically. As a result, this method does not have to be overloaded to paint the control. In fact, this method should not be overridden to perform any painting operations because it would defeat the purpose of the control and re-introduce flickering problems.

Ideally, well-written controls will move any and all painting operations from the OnPaint method into the OnPaintOffScreen method, and avoid overriding OnPaint entirely. By keeping the OnPaint method as lightweight as possible, user interfaces remain responsive and free from flickering problems.

example.para: This example demonstrates how a user control is upgraded from Control to the DoubleBufferedControl class. Upgrading is straightforward: All painting operations are moved from OnPaint to OnPaintOffScreen and OnPaint is no longer overridden.

code.title: [New Example]
code.description: Before: A control's paint operations before being upgraded to use the DoubleBufferedControl class.

example.code: Public Class MyControl Inherits Control Protected Overrides Sub OnPaint(ByVal e As PaintEventArgs) Dim MyBrush As New SolidBrush(Color.Blue) e.Graphics.FillRectangle(MyBrush, New Rectangle(50, 50, 50, 50)) MyBrush.Dispose(); End Sub End Class

code.title: [New Example]
code.description: Before: A control's paint operations before being upgraded to use the DoubleBufferedControl class.

code.title: [New Example]
code.description: After: A control's paint operations after upgrading to DoubleBufferedControl.

example.code: Public Class MyControl Inherits DoubleBufferedControl Protected Overrides Sub OnPaintOffScreen(ByVal e As CancelablePaintEventArgs) Dim MyBrush As New SolidBrush(Color.Blue) e.Graphics.FillRectangle(MyBrush, New Rectangle(50, 50, 50, 50)) MyBrush.Dispose(); End Sub End Class

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the DoubleBufferedControl class.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases memory and GDI resources created by the control.

remarks.para: This method is very important to implement properly when working with controls. Any Brush, Pen, Font, Matrix, GraphicsPath, Region or other GDI+ object containing a Dispose method must be disposed of before they are destructed by the garbage collector.

Well-written controls will create unmanaged GDI+ objects outside of the OnPaintOffScreen method, then dispose of them during the Dispose method. This practice improves performance by creating as new new objects and resources as possible while minimizing problems which may occur due to resources which are not properly released.

Failure to call the Dispose method on GDI+ objects will cause memory leaks which will slowly eat up available memory until the application can no longer function. Use the "GDI Objects" column of the Windows Task Manager to monitor the number of GDI objects allocated. Memory leaks will cause the GDI Object count to increase continuously, whereas well-written controls will experience a GDI Object count that remains fairly constant over a longer period of time.
To view the GDI Objects column in the Windows Task Manager:

list.item: Select "Choose Columns..." from the View menu.
Check the "GDI Objects" box and click OK.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.ColorFromAhsb(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a color from HSB (hue, saturation, brightness) to RGB.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.ExceptionOccurred
member.summary: Occurs when an exception is thrown during off-screen painting operations.

remarks.para: When the control is rendering on a separate thread, exceptions cannot be caught by a regular Try..Catch statement. Exceptions are instead channeled through this event. The control will also attempt to display exception information on-screen to inform developers of the code which failed.

It is important to capture this event or override the OnPaintException method in order to be properly notified of problems. Without doing this, the control could fail to paint properly yet give no indication that there is a problem.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.PaintOffScreen
member.summary: Occurs when the control is to be redrawn in the background.
member.remarks: In the DoubleBufferedControl class, all painting occurs off-screen. Then, the off-screen bitmap is quickly drawn on-screen when painting completes. This event is called immediately after the PaintOffScreenBackground event.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.PaintOffScreenBackground
member.summary: Occurs when the control's background is to be redrawn before the main graphics of the control.
member.remarks: In the DoubleBufferedControl class, all painting occurs off-screen. Then, the off-screen bitmap is quickly drawn on-screen when painting completes. This event is called to paint any background graphics before the main elements of the control are drawn. Some painting effects, such as glass or plastic, use this event along with PaintOffScreenAdornments to add annotations to the control. This event is called immediately before the PaintOffScreen event.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.PaintOffScreenAdornments
member.summary: Occurs when additional graphics or annotations must be added to the control.
member.remarks: In the DoubleBufferedControl class, all painting occurs off-screen. Then, the off-screen bitmap is quickly drawn on-screen when painting completes. This event is called to paint any additional graphics after the main elements of the control are drawn. Some painting effects, such as glass, adding text or logos, use this event to draw on the control. This event is called immediately after the PaintOffScreen event.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Indicates whether the control is currently running inside of a Windows Forms designer.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.IsDisposed
member.summary: Indicates if the control and its resources have been disposed.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.IsPaintingOnSeparateThread
member.summary: Indicates if all off-screen rendering takes place on a separate thread.

remarks.para: This powerful property controls whether or not rendering operations are multithreaded. When set to True, a new thread is launched and all subsequent calls to OnPaintOffScreen, OnPaintOffScreenBackground and OnPaintOffScreenAdornments occur on that thread. Thread synchronization features are enabled so that painting operations never interfere with rendering operations. The priority of the rendering thread is controlled via the ThreadPriority property.

When this property is False, the rendering thread is torn down and all rendering occurs on the owner's thread. Controls which perform significant painting operations should enable this property to allow the user interface to be more responsive. As a general rule, any intense processing should be moved away from the user interface thread.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OffScreenBitmapOffset
member.summary: Controls the upper-left portion of the off-screen bitmap to paint on-screen.
member.value: A Point structure indicating the corner of the off-screen bitmap to draw on-screen. Default is Empty.

remarks.para: If the size of the off-screen bitmap is different than the on-screen bitmap, a control may need to draw different portions of the off-screen bitmap. For example, if an off-screen bitmap is 200x200 pixels but the visible portion of the control is only 50x50 pixels, an offset of (10, 10) instructs the control to paint the off-screen bitmap from (10, 10)-(60, 60).

for most controls, this property does not need to be overridden. Controls which override this property also override the OffScreenBitmapSize property to specify a size defferent than the visible portion of the control.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OffScreenBitmap
member.summary: Returns the bitmap used for off-screen painting operations.
member.value: A Bitmap containing off-screen painted data.

remarks.para: This control maintains two separate bitmaps: an "off-screen" bitmap, where all painting operations take place, and an "on-screen" bitmap which is displayed visually to the user. When an off-screen painting operation completes successfully, the off-screen bitmap is copies to the on-screen bitmap, then painted on the display. This property returns the off-screen bitmap created during the most recent paint iteration.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.ThreadPriority
member.summary: Controls the relative priority of multithreaded painting operations.
member.value: A ThreadPriority value. Default is Normal.
member.remarks: Painting operations may require more CPU time if they represent the majority of a user interface, or if painting operations are more complicated. Performance can be improved by increasing the priority of the rendering thread. Likewise, if a control is of minor importance to an application, a lower thread priority can improve performance in more important areas of the application.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.BackColor
member.summary: Controls the background color of the control.
member.value: A Color structure representing the background color.
member.remarks: The default BackColor property of the Control class cannot be accessed from a thread other than the UI thread. As a result, this property was shadowed in order to make it thread-safe.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.IsExceptionTextAllowed
member.summary: Controls whether exception messages are displayed on the control.
member.remarks: In some situations, an exception can occur during a paint operation. To notify developers of the problem, the error text is written directly to the control. This behavior may not be suitable for some developers, however, who want to trap errors more gracefully. Setting this property to False causes error messages to never be drawn on the control. The ExceptionOccurred event should instead be used to gracefully handle errors when they occur.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Width
member.summary: Returns the width of the control in pixels.
member.value: An Integer indicating the width of the control in pixels.
member.remarks: The default Width property of the Control class cannot be accessed from a thread other than the UI thread. As a result, this property was shadowed in order to make it thread-safe.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Size
member.summary: Returns the horizontal and vertical length of the control in pixels.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Height
member.remarks: The default Height property of the Control class cannot be accessed from a thread other than the UI thread. As a result, this property was shadowed in order to make it thread-safe.
member.summary: Returns the height of the control in pixels.
member.value: An Integer indicating the width of the control in pixels.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.OnScreenBitmap
member.summary: Returns the bitmap used to paint the visible portion of the control.
member.value: A Bitmap containing data to be painted on the display.

remarks.para: This control maintains two separate bitmaps: an "off-screen" bitmap, where all painting operations take place, and an "on-screen" bitmap which is displayed visually to the user. When an off-screen painting operation completes successfully, the off-screen bitmap is copies to the on-screen bitmap, then painted on the display. This property returns the on-screen bitmap matching what is actually seen in the control.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.TargetFramesPerSecond
member.summary: Controls the desired frame rate for rendering operations.
member.value: An Integer indicating the desired frame rate. Default is 30.

remarks.para: This property is used by controls which make use of animation effects. Typically, this property tells a control how long to delay between repaint operations, or how many frames to allocate for a certain time period. Controls which do not do any custom animation effects ignore this property and it has no effect. When this property changes, the OnTargetFrameRateChanged virtual method is called.

If a control is able to repaint itself very quickly, smooth animation effects can be achieved. A refresh rate of 30 frames per second or above is necessary to give the human eye the illusion of motion. Refresh rates of 60 or even 120 are possible for extremely fast controls and can result in very nice, smooth animation effects.

This property can be a bit confusing for developers because it does not control the rate at which the control is actually repainted. (The control is only repainted when necessary, whenever that occurs.) This property is used only to tune custom effects implemented by controls inheriting from this class.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.GraphicsSettings
member.summary: Controls the graphics quality settings for the control.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.DoubleBufferedControl.Center
member.summary: Indicates the point at the center of the control.
member.remarks: This property is typically used for centering items in the control. This property is updated automatically as the control is resized.
member.value: A Point structure representing the pixel at the center of the control.

member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Occurs when the Value property has changed.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.IsUsingRealTimeData
member.summary: Indicates if the control should automatically display the current altitude.
member.value: A Boolean, True if the control automatically displays the current altitude.
member.remarks: When this property is enabled, the control will examine the CurrentAltitude property of the DotSpatial.Positioning.Gps.Devices class and update itself when the property changes. When disabled, the Value property must be set manually to change the control.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.ValueFont
member.summary: Controls the font used for displaying altitude text.
member.remarks: This property controls the font used to display altitude text on the control. To control the font of numbers drawn around the edge of the control, see the AltitudeLabelFont property.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.ValueColor
member.summary: Controls the color of altitude text.
member.remarks: This property controls the color of the altitude text on the control. To change the color of numbers drawn around the edge of the control, see the AltitudeLabelColor property.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.ValueInterpolationMethod
member.summary: Controls how the control smoothly transitions from one value to another.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.ValueFormat
member.summary: Controls the format of altitude values.
member.value: A String which is compatible with the ToString method of the Distance class.
member.remarks: This property controls how text is output on the control. By default, the format is "v uu" where v represents the numeric portion of the altitude, and uu represents units.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.Value
member.summary: Controls the altitude to display on the control.
member.value: A Distance structure measuring the altitude to display.
member.remarks: Changing this property causes the needles on the control to move so that they represent the value.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.AltitudeLabelColor
member.summary: Controls the color of numbers around the edge of the control.
member.remarks: This property controls the color of numbers around the edge of the control. To control the color of altitude text, see the ValueColor property.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.AltitudeLabelFont
member.summary: Controls the font of numbers drawn around the edge of the control.
member.remarks: This property controls the font used to draw numbers around the edge of the control. To control the font used to draw altitude text, see the ValueFont property.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Controls the color of smaller tick marks drawn around the edge of the control.
member.remarks: Minor tick marks are drawn between major tick marks around the control. These tick marks can be made invisible by changing the color to Transparent.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Altimeter.MajorTickColor
member.remarks: There are ten major tick marks in an altimeter, drawn next to numbers on the control. These tick marks can be made invisible by changing the color to Transparent.

member.remarks: The tens-of-thousands needle is the smallest needle of the control. The interior can be made invisible by setting this property to Transparent.

member.summary: Represents a user control which displays the local or satellite-derived time.

member.summary: The constructor provides a name for the control. This name is used as the name of the thread if multithreading is enabled.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.OnPaintOffScreen(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called whenever the control must be rendered. All rendering takes place off-screen, which prevents flickering. The "PolarControl" base class automatically handles tasks such as resizing and smoothing. All you have to be concerned with is calculating the polar coordinates to draw.

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value changes

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.MinorTickColor
member.summary: Controls the color of smaller tick marks drawn around the edge of the control.
member.remarks: Minor tick marks are drawn between major tick marks around the control. These tick marks can be made invisible by changing the color to Transparent.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.MajorTickColor
member.remarks: There are ten major tick marks in an altimeter, drawn next to numbers on the control. These tick marks can be made invisible by changing the color to Transparent.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.HoursFont
member.summary: Controls the font used to draw the hour labels around the edge of the clock.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.HoursColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the shortest hand on the clock, representing hours.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.MinutesColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the minutes hand on the clock.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.SecondsColor
member.summary: Controls the color of the seconds hand on the clock.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.DisplayMode
member.summary: Controls the technique used to display the current time.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.UpdateInterval
member.summary: Controls the amount of time allowed to elapse before the clock is refreshed with the latest time report. This property works only when the control is set to display the local machine's time.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.Value
member.summary: Controls the time being displayed by the device.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.Clock.ValueColor
member.summary: Controls the color used to paint numeric labels for hours.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator
member.summary: Calculates intermediate colors between two other colors.

remarks.para: This class is used to create a smooth transition from one color to another. After specifying a start color, end color, and number of intervals, the indexer will return a calculated Color. Specifying a greater number of intervals creates a smoother color gradient.
Instances of this class are guaranteed to be thread-safe because the class uses thread synchronization.
On the .NET Compact Framework, the alpha channel is not supported.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.#ctor(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance.
member.param: A Color at the start of the sequence.
A Color at the end of the sequence.
The total number of colors in the sequence, including the start and end colors.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a calculated color in the sequence.
member.value: A Color value representing a calculated color.
member.param: An Integer between 0 and Count minus one.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.InterpolationMethod
member.summary: Controls the interpolation technique used to calculate intermediate colors.
member.value: An InterpolationMethod value indicating the interpolation technique. Default is Linear.
member.remarks: This property controls the rate at which the start color transitions to the end color. Values other than Linear can "accelerate" and/or "decelerate" towards the end color.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.StartColor
member.summary: Controls the first color in the sequence.
member.value: A Color object representing the first color in the sequence.
member.remarks: Changing this property causes the entire sequence to be recalculated.
member.example: This example changes the start color from Green to Orange.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.EndColor
member.value: A Color object representing the last color in the sequence.
member.summary: Controls the last color in the sequence.
member.remarks: Changing this property causes the entire sequence to be recalculated.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.ColorInterpolator.Count
member.summary: Controls the number of colors in the sequence.
member.remarks: Changing this property causes the entire sequence to be recalculated.
member.value: An Integer indicating the total number of colors, including the start and end colors.

member.summary: Controls the number of degrees in between each small tick mark around the control.

member.summary: Controls the color of the interior of the needle which points North.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.CancelablePaintEventArgs
member.summary: Represents information about a cancelable paint iteration.
member.remarks: This class is used primarily by the OnPaintOffScreen method of the DoubleBufferedControl class when paint operations need to be performed. This class behaves the same as PaintEventArgs, but includes an extra IsCanceled property to indicate when a rendering iteration should be aborted.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.CancelablePaintEventArgs.#ctor(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified Graphics object and clipping rectangle.
member.param: A Graphics object used for all painting within the control.
A Rectangle that defines the area that should be painted. Typically the size of the entire control.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.CancelablePaintEventArgs.Canceled
member.summary: Indicates if the painting operation should be completely aborted.
member.value: A Boolean, True if painting was aborted. Default is False.

remarks.para: This property is used by controls which allow their paint operations to be cancelled. When set to True, the entire painting iteration is stopped and restarted. This property is useful if a control always needs to display the very latest information.

Setting this property to True can have some undesirable affects. For example, if a paint iteration is cancelled repeatedly, the control will never get far enough in a paint operation to paint on-screen. Some care should be taken when using this property.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings
member.summary: Represents a collection of rendering performance and quality settings.

remarks.para: This class is used to control the quality of all painting operations in GIS.NET. Settings are biased either towards rendering performance, quality, or a compromise between the two. The HighPerformance static member is used to paint quickly at the cost of quality; the HighQuality member paints better-looking results but painting operations require more time. The Balanced member provides minimal quality improvements while preserving moderate rendering speed.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.Balanced
member.summary: Represents graphics settings balanced between quality and rendering performance.
member.value: A GraphicsSettings object.

remarks.para: When this setting is used, painting operations will enable a few quality-improving features while still allowing for faster rendering performance. This quality setting is recommended for "draft" quality, where a more responsive map is preferable to quality.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.HighQuality
member.summary: Represents graphics settings which maximize quality.
member.value: A GraphicsSettings object.
member.remarks: This is the default setting used by the GIS.NET rendering engine. All possible smoothing features are enabled, including anti-aliasing, bicubic image interpolation, and ClearText. With this setting, the smallest geographic features and even most text are readable. This setting is recommended for production use, as well as printing.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.HighPerformance
member.summary: Represents graphics settings which maximize rendering performance.
member.value: A GraphicsSettings object.
member.remarks: When this setting is used, all quality enhancement features are disabled. The resulting map will render more quickly, but the resulting quality will be hardly suitable for production use. This setting is best suited for situations where panning and zooming performance must have all possible speed.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance.

member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified settings.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.Apply(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Applies the graphics settings to the specified grahpics container.
member.param: A Graphics object.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.CompositingQuality
member.summary: Controls the technique used to merge bitmap images.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Controls the method used to calculate color values between pixels.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.PixelOffsetMode
member.summary: Controls the amount of shift for each pixel to improve anti-aliasing.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.SmoothingMode
member.summary: Controls the technique used to blend edges.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Controls the technique used to smoothen the edges of text.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.GraphicsSettings.TextContrast
member.summary: Controls the amount of gamma correction applied to text.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarControlEffect
member.summary: Indicates the special effect applied to polar controls during painting.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarControlEffect.None
member.summary: No effect is applied.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarControlEffect.Glass
member.summary: Additional painting is performed during OnPaintOffScreenBackground and OnPaintOffScreenAdornments to give the appearance of lighting and glass.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate
member.summary: Represents a coordinate measured relative to the center of a circle.

remarks.para: Instances of this class are guaranteed to be thread-safe because the class is immutable (its properties can only be changed via constructors).

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.Empty
member.summary: Represents a polar coordinate with no value.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.Center
member.summary: Represents a polar coordinate at the center of a circle.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.#ctor(System.Single,DotSpatial.Positioning.Angle)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified radius and angle.
member.param: A Double indicating a radius. Increasing values represent a distance further away from the center of a circle.
An Angle representing a direction from the center of a circle.
member.remarks: The radius "r," when combined with an angle "theta" will create a coordinate relative to the center of a circle. By default, an angle of zero represents the top of the circle ("North") and increasing angles wind clockwise around the circle.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.#ctor(System.Single,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified radius and angle.
member.param: A Double indicating a radius. Increasing values represent a distance further away from the center of a circle.
An Angle representing a direction from the center of a circle.
member.remarks: The radius "r," when combined with an angle "theta" will create a coordinate relative to the center of a circle. By default, an angle of zero represents the top of the circle ("North") and increasing angles wind clockwise around the circle.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.#ctor(System.Single,DotSpatial.Positioning.Angle,DotSpatial.Positioning.Azimuth,DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinateOrientation)
member.summary: Creates a new instance using the specified radius, angle, origin and winding direction.
member.param: A Double indicating a radius. Increasing values represent a distance further away from the center of a circle.
An Angle representing a direction from the center of a circle.
An Azimuth indicating which compass direction is associated with zero degrees. (Typically North.)
A PolarCoordinateOrientation value indicating whether increasing Theta values wind clockwise or counter-clockwise.
member.remarks: The radius "r," when combined with an angle "theta" will create a coordinate relative to the center of a circle. The BearingOrigin will associate a compass direction with zero degrees (0), but this value is typically "North".

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinate.#ctor(System.Single,System.Double,DotSpatial.Positioning.Azimuth,DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarCoordinateOrientation)
member.summary: Creates a new Polar Coordinate

member.param: A String describing a polar coordinate in the current culture.

member.summary: Creates a new instance by converting the specified string.
member.param: A String describing a polar coordinate in any culture.
A CultureInfo object describing how to parse the specified string.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarGraphics.Orientation
member.summary: Returns whether positive values are applied in a clockwise or counter-clockwise direction.

member.summary: Returns the value of R associated with the center of the control.

member.summary: Returns the value of R associated with the edge of the control.

member.summary: Returns the GDI+ drawing surface used for painting.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Positioning.Forms.PolarGraphics.Rotation
member.summary: Returns the amount of rotation applied to the entire control.
